Package projetofinalpoo

Class Publication

java.lang.Object
projetofinalpoo.Publication
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Publication>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Book, ConferenceArticle, MagazineArticle
public abstract class Publication
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Publication>
A Publication is an abstract class that represents a publication made by a researcher or a group of researchers. It is defined by its authors, its title, its summary, its keywords, its publication year, its audience and its type. The default type of a Publication object is "unknown".

Besides the gets, sets, constructors and toString methods, a Publication class has a abstract method and a compareTo() method. The abstract class will be implemented in the child classes of a Publication. The compareTo() method is used to compare 2 publications about their factor of impact.

A Publication is serializable so it can be saved to a binary/object file. It also implements Comparable.

See Also:

    • Publication

      public Publication()
      Sole constructor. Initializes the keywords and authors ArrayLists and initializes the default value of type to "unknown"

    • Publication

      public Publication​(java.lang.String title, java.util.List<Researcher> authors, java.lang.String summary, java.util.List<java.lang.String> keywords, int publicationYear, int audience)
      Constructor that initializes the values of the title, list of authors, summary, list of keywords, publication year and audience.
      Parameters:
      title - , title of the Publication
      authors - , authors of the Publication
      summary - , summary that describes the Publication
      keywords - , keywords that define the Publication
      publicationYear - , year on which the Publication was released
      audience - , amount of people who saw the Publication

      public int compareTo​(Publication pub)

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Method that describes the characteristics of a Publication. It returns a string in the following format:

      Title : __, Summary : __, Type : __

      Keywords : __

      Authors : __, Publication Year : __

      Note: __ is the place where the values are going to appear (they change object to object)

      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a String that describes a Publication object
